verses.verse: Let us therefore <S%G3767><s%> fear, <S%G5399><s%> lest, <S%G3379><s%> a promise <S%G1860><s%> being left <S%G2641><s%> us of entering <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> his rest, <S%G2663><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> of you should seem <S%G1380><s%> to come <S%G5302><s%> short <S%G5302><s%> of it.

For to us was the gospel <S%G2097><s%> preached, <S%G2097><s%> as well <S%G2509><s%> as to them: but the word <S%G3056><s%> preached <S%G189><s%> did not profit <S%G5623><s%> them, not being mixed <S%G4786><s%> with faith <S%G4102><s%> in them that heard <S%G191><s%> it.

For we which <S%G3588><s%> have believed <S%G4100><s%> do enter <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> rest, <S%G2663><s%> as he said, <S%G2046><s%> As I have sworn <S%G3660><s%> in my wrath, <S%G3709><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> they shall enter <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> my rest: <S%G2663><s%> although <S%G2543><s%> the works <S%G2041><s%> were finished <S%G1096><s%> from the foundation <S%G2602><s%> of the world. <S%G2889><s%>

For he spoke <S%G2046><s%> in a certain <S%G4225><s%> place of the seventh <S%G1442><s%> day on this <S%G3779><s%> wise, <S%G3779><s%> And God <S%G2316><s%> did rest <S%G2664><s%> the seventh <S%G1442><s%> day <S%G2250><s%> from all <S%G3956><s%> his works. <S%G2041><s%>
And in this <S%G5129><s%> place again, <S%G3825><s%> If <S%G1487><s%> they shall enter <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> my rest. <S%G2663><s%>

Seeing <S%G1893><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> it remains <S%G620><s%> that some <S%G5100><s%> must enter <S%G1525><s%> therein, <S%G1519><s%> <S%G846><s%> and they to whom it was first <S%G4386><s%> preached <S%G2097><s%> entered <S%G1525><s%> not in because <S%G1223><s%> of unbelief: <S%G543><s%>

Again, <S%G3825><s%> he limits <S%G3724><s%> a certain <S%G5100><s%> day, <S%G2250><s%> saying <S%G3004><s%> in David, <S%G1138><s%> To day, <S%G4594><s%> after <S%G3326><s%> so <S%G5118><s%> long <S%G5118><s%> a time; <S%G5550><s%> as it is said, <S%G2046><s%> To day <S%G4594><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> you will hear <S%G191><s%> his voice, <S%G5456><s%> harden <S%G4645><s%> not your <S%G5216><s%> hearts. <S%G2588><s%>

For if <S%G1487><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> had given them rest, <S%G2664><s%> then would he not afterward <S%G3326><s%> <S%G5023><s%> have spoken <S%G2980><s%> of another <S%G243><s%> day. <S%G2250><s%>
There remains <S%G620><s%> therefore <S%G686><s%> a rest <S%G4520><s%> to the people <S%G2992><s%> of God. <S%G2316><s%>

For he that is entered <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> his rest, <S%G2663><s%> he also <S%G2532><s%> has ceased <S%G2664><s%> from his own <S%G848><s%> works, <S%G2041><s%> as God <S%G2316><s%> did from his.

Let us labor <S%G4704><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> to enter <S%G1525><s%> into <S%G1519><s%> that rest, <S%G2663><s%> lest <S%G2443><s%> <S%G3361><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> man fall <S%G4098><s%> after <S%G1722><s%> the same <S%G846><s%> example <S%G5262><s%> of unbelief. <S%G543><s%>

For the word <S%G3056><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%> is quick, <S%G2198><s%> and powerful, <S%G1756><s%> and sharper <S%G5114><s%> than <S%G5228><s%> any <S%G3956><s%> two edged <S%G1366><s%> sword, <S%G3162><s%> piercing <S%G1338><s%> even to the dividing <S%G3311><s%> asunder of soul <S%G5590><s%> and spirit, <S%G4151><s%> and of the joints <S%G719><s%> and marrow, <S%G3452><s%> and is a discerner <S%G2924><s%> of the thoughts <S%G1761><s%> and intents <S%G1771><s%> of the heart. <S%G2588><s%>

Neither <S%G2532><s%> <S%G3756><s%> is there any creature <S%G2937><s%> that is not manifest <S%G852><s%> in his sight: <S%G1799><s%> but all <S%G3956><s%> things are naked <S%G1131><s%> and opened <S%G5136><s%> to the eyes <S%G3788><s%> of him with whom <S%G3739><s%> we have to do. <S%G3588><s%> <S%G3056><s%>

Seeing then <S%G3767><s%> that we have <S%G2192><s%> a great <S%G3173><s%> high <S%G749><s%> priest, <S%G749><s%> that is passed <S%G1330><s%> into the heavens, <S%G3772><s%> Jesus <S%G2424><s%> the Son <S%G5207><s%> of God, <S%G2316><s%> let us hold <S%G2902><s%> fast our profession. <S%G3671><s%>

For we have <S%G2192><s%> not an high <S%G749><s%> priest <S%G749><s%> which cannot <S%G3361><s%> <S%G1410><s%> be touched <S%G4834><s%> with the feeling <S%G4834><s%> of our infirmities; <S%G769><s%> but was in all <S%G3956><s%> points tempted <S%G3985><s%> like <S%G2596><s%> <S%G3665><s%> as we are, yet without <S%G5565><s%> sin. <S%G266><s%>

Let us therefore <S%G3767><s%> come <S%G4334><s%> boldly <S%G3954><s%> to the throne <S%G2362><s%> of grace, <S%G5485><s%> that we may obtain <S%G2983><s%> mercy, <S%G1656><s%> and find <S%G2147><s%> grace <S%G5485><s%> to help <S%G996><s%> in time <S%G2121><s%> of need. <S%G2121><s%>
